description: People without access to capital are getting into housing development in Philadelphia. It's part of a program designed to create more affordable housing and boost non-traditional developers.
title: Philadelphia program aims to create affordable housing developers

description: Montgomery County Police Department Officer Laurie Reyes speaks with NPR about the autism and dementia unit that is saving lives and helping families in Maryland.
title: This police department's autism unit is saving lives

description: There's a term companies are using more often recently: “price pack architecture.” It's meant to be a way to get customers to buy more, sometimes for more money per unit.
title: Companies are using 'price pack architecture' to get consumers to buy more

description: For over a decade, Israel has looked to the Iron Dome missile defense system to protect citizens from attack. But experts warn a war with Hezbollah could test it like never before.
title: Could Israel’s Iron Dome missile defense system hold up in a war with Hezbollah?

description: Collective prayers and struggles are core to Islam's Hajj, but heat took a toll this year: Hundreds died and thousands sought treatment for heat exhaustion.
title: Hundreds of Muslim pilgrims died in heat-stricken Hajj

description: States overhauling Medicaid rolls have accidentally dropped eligible people from coverage, sometimes for months. That can be dangerous for those who need opioid addiction medications.
title: 'Medicaid unwinding' can be dangerous for those who need opioid addiction medications

description: The best player in hockey is having a record-breaking run in the postseason. Could a Stanley Cup be enough to make him a household name in the U.S.?
title: NHL's Connor McDavid shines

description: A judge has potentially killed the fake elector case in Nevada with a ruling that state prosecutors chose the wrong venue to file the case. The state attorney general says he will appeal.
title: Judge dismisses charges in Nevada pro-Trump fake electors case over venue question

description: Playing outside can now become dangerous as climate change fuels longer and more intense heat waves. Camps in Louisiana are making adjustments to deal with higher temperatures this summer.
title: The South is adapting to help keep kids safe as summer heat intensifies

description: Deaths this year at the hajj offer a glimpse into the toll heat and humidity are taking on one of Islam's key pillars, raising questions around whether climate change is harming the pilgrimage.
title: Heat killed hundreds of Muslims in Saudi Arabia for this year's hajj pilgrimage

description: The baseball Hall of Famer spoke on a panel for a Negro League tribute game, saying he wouldn't wish his racism experiences on anyone. “They would point at me and say 'the n***** can't eat here.’ ”
title: Baseball great Reggie Jackson opens up on TV about racism he faced as a player

description: The recent Senate hearing with Boeing’s CEO underscored how much whistleblowers can do to hold powerful companies accountable. It was also a reminder of how vulnerable they are to retaliation.
title: Boeing hearing is a moment of vindication for whistleblowers, but at a steep cost

description: U.S. Customs and Border Protection reports declining number of migrants attempting to cross the border since an all-time high in December
title: Encounters at the U.S. border drop 9% in May, before asylum restrictions kicked in

description: As pride month celebrations continue, LGBTQ lawmakers are working to expand their ranks in D.C. next year. The Equality PAC — the political arm of the Equality Caucus in the U.S. Congress — is raising millions to boost representation on Capitol Hill.
title: Equality PAC raises millions to boost LGBTQ representation in Congress

description: Linda Tirado, 42, lost her eye and suffered a brain injury after being shot by Minneapolis police in 2020. The National Press Club said she developed dementia as a result and "is at life's end."
title: A journalist shot by police while covering the 2020 protests is dying of her injuries

description: The decision was the first major gun ruling since 2022 when the high court broke sharply with the way gun laws had previously been handled by the court.
title: Supreme Court upholds federal ban on guns for domestic abusers

description: The award-winning playwright talks about his provocative Slave Play, which earned 12 Tony nominations. A new HBO documentary chronicles the making of the production. Originally broadcast June 2023.
title: 'Slave Play' playwright Jeremy O. Harris is on a mission to diversify theater

description: The decision was the first major gun ruling since 2022 when the high court broke sharply with the way gun laws had previously been handled by the courts.
title: Supreme Court upholds federal ban on guns for domestic abusers

description: After a tumultuous few years in British politics, with Brexit and multiple prime ministers, one lasting less than two months, U.K. voters will go to the polls on July 4th. Many in Britain say their country feels broken. Our correspondent in London takes a look at what the U.K.'s next prime minister will inherit.
title: Are British Politics Broken?

description: The British journalist picked to be the Washington Post's new editor says he won't take the job after all, following controversy around his involvement in ethically questionable journalism practices.
title: Drama compounds in The Post's highest ranks as new editor declines job

description: Washington Post Chief Executive and Publisher Will Lewis' pick to be its lead editor has withdrawn from the job. Robert Winnett of the U.K.'s Telegraph was scheduled to start after the U.S. elections.
title: After uproar over ethics, new 'Washington Post' editor won't take the job

description: Washington Post Chief Executive and Publisher Will Lewis' pick to be its lead editor has withdrawn from the job. Robert Winnett of the U.K.'s Telegraph was scheduled to start after the U.S. elections.
title: After uproar over ethics, new 'Washington Post' editor won't take the job

description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with outgoing NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg about his decade in office and the challenges faced by the North Atlantic alliance.
title: Jens Stoltenberg steps down after a decade as NATO Secretary-General

description: TikTok’s first court filings detail plans to challenge a potential ban on the app. Travelers buying carbon offsets might not get their money’s worth.
title: TikTok reveals failed negotiations with U.S. government; do carbon offsets work?

description: Libertarian presidential nominee Chase Oliver wants to take on the two-party system. But before he can appeal to outside voters, he’s got to convince members of his own party to support him.
title: As voters suffer presidential election deja vu, Chase Oliver wants to be another option

description: Chemical companies and water utilities are challenging the EPA’s recent rule putting limits on six PFAS chemicals in drinking water.
title: The EPA's new limits on PFAS in drinking water face legal challenges

description: The Moscow-based company said in a statement that the U.S. Commerce Department’s decision would not affect its ability to sell and promote its cyber security products and training in the U.S.
title: Cybersecurity firm Kaspersky denies it's a hazard after the U.S. bans its software

description: Major League Baseball played at historic Rickwood Field in Birmingham, Ala., Thursday. It is where Willie Mays, who died this week at age 93, made his professional debut in the Negro Leagues.
title: MLB game in Alabama takes on extra significance following Willie Mays' death

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to emergency room physician Dr. George Chiampas about how to stay healthy during the heat wave.
title: Extreme temperatures can cause all sorts of heat-related illnesses

description: Banning smartphones in schools is one of those rare policies that Republicans and Democrats seem to agree on but it hasn’t always been a popular idea — so what’s changed?
title: Is a statewide ban on cell phones in schools realistic?

description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Jean-Yves Camus of the French think-tank IRIS, about the rise of the far right in the country, and what's at stake in legislative elections.
title: Poll: France’s far-right party is on a path to win snap parliamentary elections

description: More family medicine and primary care doctors are doing abortions and questioning why it’s been separated from other care for decades.
title: Abortion is becoming more common in primary care clinics as doctors challenge stigma

description: NASA and other federal agencies recently did a tabletop simulation of an Earth-threatening asteroid to see how they'd handle it
title: Asteroid headed toward Earth? NASA simulation explores how the nation might respond

description: This week, there were Tony Award wins and new Team USA outfits dropped. Something pretty great was found at George Washington's old home, too. Did you follow all the news?
title: Which celebrity's mugshot set the internet ablaze this week? Find out in the quiz

description: Spotted lanternflies have been seen in California, where the invasive species poses a risk to the state's lucrative wine industry.
title: Spotted lanternfly eggs found attached to an art installation headed for California’s wine country

description: A worldwide poll from the United Nations of more than 75,000 people shows a vast majority want governments to do more to address climate change.
title: A new global survey shows that people everywhere are concerned about climate change

description: Sisters Mai Lo Lee and Beth Lo, who grew up in a large Hmong family, recall their youth spent in a refugee camp in Thailand and on a ginseng farm in Wisconsin.
title: 2 sisters, who fled the Vietnam War as kids, reflect on what they've been through

description: Steve Bannon, a longtime ally of Donald Trump, is supposed to report to prison by July 1 to begin serving his four-month sentence for contempt of Congress.
title: Appeals court panel refuses to delay Trump ally Steve Bannon’s prison sentence
